intro: [WRONG START] Embilia ribes var. pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved embelia, is a variant of the embelia plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a small, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
